senses.sense_definition: To straighten something that has been rolled, twisted, or curled.

examples.text: Please help me <w>unroll</w> the new carpet in the living room.
He began to <w>unroll</w> the map on the table to show us the route.

senses.sense_definition: To emerge, be revealed, or become apparent; to unfold.

examples.text: We waited anxiously to see how the events would <w>unroll</w> over the weekend.
As the story began to <w>unroll</w>, the audience sat in complete silence.

senses.sense_definition: To replace a loop in a computer program with a repetitive sequence of individual instructions.

examples.text: The compiler attempts to <w>unroll</w> the loop to increase execution speed.
Programmers sometimes manually <w>unroll</w> loops for better optimization.
